question_text: Figure 7 shows a wave on the surface of water. Explain why the wave shown in Figure 7 is a transverse wave.

question_text: Figure 8 shows a ripple tank. A screen is placed below the ripple tank. The wave pattern produced by the ripples can be seen on the screen. Describe how the student could measure the frequency of the ripples.
subject: Physics

question_text: Figure 8 shows a ripple tank. A screen is placed below the ripple tank. The wave pattern produced by the ripples can be seen on the screen. Describe how the student could measure the wavelength of the ripples.
subject: Physics

question_text: In a swimming pool, a wave is produced with a wavelength of 4.0 m and a velocity of 0.8 m/s. Calculate the frequency of the wave. State the unit of frequency. Use the equation v = f × λ frequency of wave .............................................................. unit
subject: Physics

question_text: Figure 9 shows a metal cube filled with hot water. Four sides of the cube have different surfaces, as shown in Figure 9. The thermal energy radiated by each side of the box is measured using a thermal energy detector connected to a millivoltmeter. The detector is moved to get a reading of the thermal energy emitted from each side of the box. Suggest a possible millivoltmeter reading for the shiny black surface.
subject: Physics

question_text: Figure 9 shows a metal cube filled with hot water. Four sides of the cube have different surfaces, as shown in Figure 9. The thermal energy radiated by each side of the box is measured using a thermal energy detector connected to a millivoltmeter. The detector is moved to get a reading of the thermal energy emitted from each side of the box. State what must be kept the same to take the measurement for each surface.
subject: Physics

question_text: Figure 9 shows a metal cube filled with hot water. Four sides of the cube have different surfaces, as shown in Figure 9. The thermal energy radiated by each side of the box is measured using a thermal energy detector connected to a millivoltmeter. question_text: A hot surface emits radiation of different wavelengths. The graph in Figure 11 shows how the intensity of the radiation emitted changes with the wavelength. Describe how intensity changes with wavelength in Figure 11.
subject: Physics
